title: How to Make Crawfish Bisque

steps.headline: Prepare the crawfish as follows:  Take firm hold of the crawfish with one hand so as to avoid being pinched by its claws; with the thumb and forefinger of the  other hand pinch the extreme end of the central fin of the tail, and, with a sudden jerk, the gut will be withdrawn.
Dice the carrot, onion, celery, and parsley roots.
Put these in a stew pan with the bay leaf, thyme, dash of minionette pepper and butter and fry for 10 minutes.
Then add the crawfish and ½ bottle of white wine.
Bring this to a boil and add the consommé, then boil for another 30 minutes.
Remove the crawfish and strain the broth into a bowl with pressure through a napkin.
Remove the tails from 25 of the crawfish and place them in the bottom of a soup tureen.
Place about a dozen of the empty shells on a baking sheet and dry in the oven.
Crush them in a mortar with a little lobster coral and 4 oz butter, making a fine paste.
Simmer over low heat for 5 minutes, then press through a sieve into cold water.
Once the colored butter has set, remove from the water and place in the refrigerator.
Fry the French roll crusts in butter until golden brown.
Pound the crusts, anchovies, and 5 remaining crawfish together.
Mix this with the broth strained previously in a saucepan and warm.
Puree this mixture through a sieve into a stewpot.
Mix in the crawfish butter, lemon juice, and a dash of cayenne pepper and heat over medium flame.
Pour this bisque into the tureen with the crawfish tails and serve.
